Reviews.Title: “Mr. Bartender”
Reviews.Author: Diwana C
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we were told "Happy Hour" is 4:00 to 7:00 p.m. The sign on the door to bar/resturant said 4:00 to 7:00 "Happy Hour." We went to the bar at 6:25 and was told "Happy Hour" is over. We didn't argue with him and paid our tab. I would like for someone to inform him of the times. Also, no comforters on beds so ask for blankets at check in. Bathrooms are way too small. Our remote control for the t.v. went out and we took it to the desk. They had no replacements or batteries.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust website”
Reviews.Author: FunFilledFamily
Reviews.Content: Booked two nights for Girls Weekend based off online description of a "luxury" boutique hotel and rate of $112 a night. To make a long story short, room was clean but unusually tiny with a tv from the 80s, laptop size desk, and cute but tiny bathroom with no counter space and a hidden toilet paper roll holder (I dare you to try and find it). Tried to leave as soon as we saw room (BTW, some floors are smoking like the first one they tried to put us in so ask) but manager Mark refused to override cancellation policy (we did cancel our second night) and after asking for a blanket for our bed (you'd think it would be included), we spent the night and checked out the next morning. Check out was sneaky- they upped our price per night to $169 and tried to charge us for 2 days of valet for a 14 hour stay. Alexandra fixed it for us but only after being on the phone for 10 minutes getting directions and permission from someone in hotel. The couple behind us were checking out early too for same reason.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: FSTriptych
Reviews.Content: It had been a few years since I'd stayed at Hotel Lawrence, and upon reading the reviews of it on this site, I was a little frightened it might have changed from the sweet place we'd liked before. Each to their own, but we still loved it. I like to travel to Dallas via Amtrak, and the hotel is straight across from Union Station, just one perk of its great location. It is old. Now, if old isn't an attraction for you, stay somewhere new. Old has problems sometimes, but old also has charm. Maintenance on a building constructed in 1925 is a full-time job. The elevator is slow. Big deal. It's OLD. It's not all that small, either. It adequately transported the three of us up and down in plenty of time. Our room on the 7th floor was impeccably clean. It was small on an American scale, but large on a European one. The two beds had nice linens, and good mattresses and pillows. The bathroom door had a few problems -- the knob mechanism was broken, but the door still shut. The bathroom was well designed and amply stocked with fresh towels, and products. There was a closet for sweaters and coats, which we brought but didn't need. There were plenty of other storage possibilities in the room as well. One of the nicest facets of the hotel being old is that is has windows that actually open. We enjoyed the sights and sounds and cool breezes it brought us with the lovely early spring weather. The room also has individually controlled heat and air, but we didn't have to use more than the "fan" setting. Several bottles of water were included, as well as a nice ice bucket and tongs. One of my few complaints was the one-cup coffee brewer. The coffee was only stocked for two, and we are big coffee drinkers. I will say in their favor that we have never had a hotel respond to a reservation for three correctly anywhere. This isn't just a problem of the Lawrence, but of hotels in general. An expanded continental breakfast is included. The breakfast room on the second floor was clean and had plenty of tables and chairs. A variety of juices, coffees, teas, and milk were available, as well as cereal, pastries, bagels and cream cheese, and waffles you could make yourself. Basic, but money saving, we enjoyed this the first day, but opted for Cindi's Deli just around the corner from the hotel for a hot breakfast the next day. Its food and service were both excellent, and it's gigantic menu could surely please just about anyone. The Founders Grill, also downstairs, had a bar and dining as well. They offer all kinds of things, but I give high praise to their burgers and Philly Cheese Steak. One of the best things about the Lawrence is that they offer shuttle service to within 3 miles of the hotel. Our Ethiopian drivers knew the city well, were good drivers, and spoke excellent English in addition to being accommodating of my being on a cane. I can't praise these gentlemen enough. I'd much rather tip them than take a cab or the hit-and-miss DART. Everyone associated with the hotel was just great. They seemed to have pride in their little antique gem, and are working hard to keep it up and running AND charming. The milk and cookies at 8 p.m. is a great perk, too. So, unless you have some kind of unrealistic ideals about what an antique, European-style downtown hotel should be, stay at Hotel Lawrence. If you are expecting shiny, new, fast, and impersonal, stay elsewhere. If you've traveled in Europe and liked it, want to be downtown, and appreciate personalized service, stay at Hotel Lawrence. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming staff, quaint building”
Reviews.Author: sherwj
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Dallas (we being two adults and a baby). I'll start off with the bad since it's a smaller list. The building is older so the rooms are smaller than new construction and the elevator is slower. Personally, I find both of these quaint but I could see how other travelers might get annoyed. Also, parking is a bear unless you pay for valet service. Also, if you're from a water conscious area the entire Dallas area will give you pause (pressure washing the streets, non-aerated shower and sink, etc.) I adored the service, despite checking in kinda late the gentleman at the front desk offered to send a crib up to the room without us having to ask and all of the staff was incredibly sweet to our 7.5 month old. Everyone was able and willing to help out from pointing us to grocery markets for snacks to finding a band aid. The hotel is in a great location, we were able to walk to most of downtown and only drove when visiting family. Not to mention the picture perfect view of the book depository from our room. Even though this is a downtown area we found it to be on the quiet side at night (not sure if that was due to the time of year or the district.) Finally, waffles in the morning and cookies at night make me a happy traveler. I would stay here again with out a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Juan Q
Reviews.Content: Hi. I recently stayed at the Hotel Lwarence, in Dallas, and my experience was a good one. All employees at the front desk were very friendly and helpful with all my questions, specially the one from Baltimore (I don't remember his name). The rate included breakfast and it had many options. The location is great, near a lot of attractions at walkable distance. For example: From my window I could see the place where JFK was killed, the Sixth Floor Museum and the Dallas Museum. I could walk to the train station and even to the American Airlines Arena, where I saw games of the NBA and NHL. The last day, my flight was in the afternoon, so, after I checked out, they kept my luggage for me so I could go out to see some places before I left back to my home. The hotel is old, it isn't a luxury one, but it was all I could ask for. Very recommendable. Thanks, Juan Quinones

Reviews.Title: “this hotel was "ok" ...i'll never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Kesia K d
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights here... and it was just "ok". The breakfast was quite less than average, not very good and this is coming from a very optimistic couple that we try and make the best of things. I would like to take this time to warn you about the location and parking....... There is no parking! You have to park in the back of the building on one of those downtown parking lots with NO security!!! And what really freaked us out was on your way to the parking lot thereâ€™s people harassing you for extra cash..... I donâ€™t like being harassed and followed! As far as the hotel.... its pretty old which is charming but they need to remodel this hotel and fix things that are broken or no god. Iâ€™ve stayed at â€˜oldâ€™ hotels in downtown San Antonio and even though they are â€˜oldâ€™ they are very clean and remodeled and donâ€™t smell like mold (the ways this hotel in Dallas did.) The AC in our room didnâ€™t work; it was always freezing because there was no way to adjust the temperature. here are some pictures of the hotel and Dallas Tx http://www.flickr.com/photos/kesiakerendlt/sets/72157627851850269/

Reviews.Title: “RUDE RUDE RUDE!”
Reviews.Author: sarahvch
Reviews.Content: We never even made it past the check in process... I found this hotel on the trip advisor forums. I was looking for a room within walking distance of The House of Blues. I read the reviews here and did see some negative comments but thought I would give it a chance. I called the hotel directly I thought, as it was listed as a Dallas number however I was connected to a "Reservation Desk". I inquired first if the hotel was within walking distance "Yes, only three blocks from The House of Blues." Wow, that is great I thought. This was very important as I would be walking back to the hotel after the concert with a 13 year old child, alone. I then asked if their valet service was secure as I read a in one of the reviews that someone had all their car windows busted when parked at the meters. I was again told "Yes, ma'am, 100 percent secure." Perfect I thought. I told the agent that I appreciated the information and would confer with my husband. We had planned to stay at the W and needed two rooms on Friday night and just one on Saturday night as my husband would be leaving early before the show. My husband was elated at the fact that I had found a bargain and said to book it if it was what I wanted. So I called back and spoke with Chasity. I again asked her the above two questions and was given the same responses with slightly different wording of course. I booked two rooms for Friday and one for Saturday evening. We arrived at Hotel Lawrence around 5:30 p.m. to check in Friday evening. We circled the building twice looking for valet service or a bellman but had no luck, so we parked at the meters and deposited money. The first thing we noticed was the right entry door of the hotel was broken and the left door was rotting. WE greeted Mark (yes, we greeted him not the other way around as he ignored our arrival at the desk) and informed him that we were checking in for the evening. I informed him that we were unable to locate valet and he replied "Are you ready to park?" "Yes" I said. "So you have unloaded your luggage?" "No, not yet." I responded thinking that there would be a bellman to help me with that. His response "Well then you are not ready to valet then. I'll take the keys when you are." My 13 year old daughter just laughed out loud in shock at his ruddiness. He asked the name on the reservation and pulled our paperwork. I then said "Are you three blocks from House of Blues as I thought it was located on the other side of 35?" He responded that it was indeed on the other side of the highway and that it was 10-12 blocks. OK I am going to make the best of this situation. I ask if they have a courtesy van or transpiration and he says yes but it will be closed after the concert. At this point his rudeness had gotten to the point that my husband who had just walked in was looking at me like what the heck is going on. I tell Mark all of the above about speaking with two of their reps and being told the same information and that I called because I had read some negative reviews on trip advisor. When I repeated the valet question to him and told him the reps response he laughed and said "no one can guarantee that." Really? seems both W and Hyatt have security on staff as well as cameras watching your vehicles! I inform my husband of my dilemma and the misinformation I was given and he suggest that we just call Hyatt Regency which is just a little over a block away and cancel this reservation due to the misinformation. Of course Mark informs me that he is the manager on duty and will be charging my card as I am no longer within the 24 hour cancelation period. I tell him to cancel tomorrows reservation and he says he can't do that either as it needed to be done by "3 p.m. central standard time". We left, called Hyatt booked two rooms for $10 bucks more and were amazed at how much help was around when we pulled up. Valet, bellman, awesome check in staff, even friendlier bellman Juan brought our luggage to our room and encouraged us to call him with any questions or request. I told the front desk about our issue at the other hotel (did not name it) because I was still in shock and he apologized as if it were his fault and said I know which hotel you are speaking of as we have been informed not to ever send anyone there if we are full. Seems Hotel Lawrence has a reputation all around town and not a good one. I HIGHLY SUGGEST SPENDING THE $10 EXTRA DOLLARS and staying at the Hyatt as the customer service alone is what would be found in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel and worse service”
Reviews.Author: Phillis_Travel
Reviews.Content: A group of 30 of us stayed here January 26-30 2012. My toilet fluhed every 30 minutes and they didn't fix it. I sked for 3 days for blankets and when I got them one was wet and teh other dirty. Many of my fellow travels complained that the heat in their rooms didn't work and it was below 35 at night. They promised us they would open breakfast early for us on Sunday so that we could get to our event. They didn't bother to tell the staff though and it didnt open in time for us. The rooms are old the carpets stained and teh pictures they show are all lies. Bypass this for something else. They promised no longer than a 15 minutes wait for a shuttle to take you locally. I had to wait 45 minutes on Friday. On Sunday morning when they promised us shuttle service at 7 a.m. we had to wait because the shuttle driver was parking cars (that's what we were told)

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, slow elevator but great in many ways”
Reviews.Author: chaco
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our three night stay on the 10th floor, very quiet, only one cold shower but then we were there for a conference with lots of women! Breakfast very nice, eggs, waffles, cottage cheese, bagels, cereal, coffee, juice, etc.

Reviews.Title: “The Closest Hotel To Dealey Plaza”
Reviews.Author: PietroMorrizio
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Dallas from Australia as I have had a very strong interest in the JFK assassination since I was in junior high school. Therefore, I selected the Hotel Lawrence because it seemed passable in terms of quality, and the location was the best one to start a day of looking at JFK assassination-related sites as it was virtually in Dealey Plaza. I got a room that faced Dealey Plaza, so I woke to Dealey Plaza covered in light snowfall. I think given my reasons for going to Dallas, the view made the hotel worth the money, as I could see the former Texas School Book Depository, Elm St, and the Grassy Knoll from my window. The room itself was not so modern - the bathroom looked newly-renovated, but the furniture & television looked a little archaic. However, I spent little time in the room, despite the cold, so for me it was fine. The breakfast was a buffet, and a little limited. I usually turn to cereal when I can't get scrambled egg & toast, so it was cereal day for me, but that was fine as I was eager to get to Dealey Plaza anyway. The night I got there, the restaurant was closed, and it was about 10pm, but luckily someone in a room ordered a pizza, so the driver took me back to the pizzeria so I could order a pizza there. I flew out after spending one full day in Dallas, and the trip from the HL to Dallas Love Field took around 30 minutes in the morning peak hour period. While there might be better quality rooms in Dallas, I think many people book here because of the JFK experience, so if that is the case and you don't have to have five-star surroundings, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but in need of an update”
Reviews.Author: cathybirdlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Lawrence for a conference. Since I'm a walker, it was within easy walking distance of the Convention Center. The DART station is also nearby. My room was small, and the colors and furniture style reminded me of the apartment I grew up in back in the '60s (avocado/Danish "modern"), but the bed was comfortable, and (like another reviewer) I could see the site of the Kennedy shooting out my window. The restaurant was very good--friendly waitstaff, tasty and reasonably priced food. The complimentary breakfast was just adequate: cereals, various pastries,a do-it-yourself waffle maker. There were juices (or juice products), but no orange juice; the coffee was lukewarm, and on one morning the carafe ran out and was not replaced speedily. There were periodic loud noises from what I'm guessing was the plumbing, which woke me up several times during the night. Worst of all, on a morning when I had several meetings coming up there was no hot water in the shower; the desk staff took care of it, but refused to give me any sort of refund for the inconvenience of not being able to shower properly on a day when I was concerned with making a good impression on quite a few people. With a serious update, the hotel has the potential to be pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Family-Friendly Area”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend wedding held at the Old Red Courthouse a couple of blocks away. We had our car parked at a meter outside the hotel on Saturday afternoon. The meters are free after 6 pm. I thought I had enough change in the machine to make it till 6. Wrong. I got a ticket at 5:37 in a nearly-deserted downtown Dallas. The next day after checking out. we discovered that my son's car had the windows busted in and some items were stolen. I guess the police were too busy protecting parking meters to watch out for anything else. Do not stay in downtown Dallas. It is just not worth it. Hotel is average.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: battydiver
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Convention Center, museums, restaurants. DART station (light rail) a few blocks away. Hotel shuttle goes within 3 miles of hotel (up to about 9pm). Front desk has coupons for nearby restaurants. Friendly front desk staff and shuttle drivers. Breakfast (open for 3 hours) is called "continental" but is much better: pastries, bagels, make-your-own-waffles, biscuits and gravy, hard boiled eggs, cold cereal, toast, yogurt, canned peaches and cottage cheese. High ceilings made up for the room being small. Furniture shows its age. Room was clean and quiet. No bed bugs. Closet small but included hanging shelves; some drawer space in nightstands. 2 free bottles of water put in room every day. Coffee maker in room. Free wifi. Computer and printer in lobby. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vintage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: poipu96756
Reviews.Content: i recently visited Dallas specifically to see the Grassy Knoll and Book Depository. i booked a room at Hotel Lawrence and found the hotel to be perfect. i was looking for an older hotel to recreate the feeling of Dallas 1963 and i found it. the view out of my window in Room 305 provided an indelible memory of Dealey Plaza. Maggie and Mark at the reception desk were wonderful as was Shane, in charge of security. the hotel allow's pets and i met some nice dogs on the elevator. this is not a fancy chain hotel, but an eclectic place full of character and history. i live in Cambodia and i planned this visit for years. Hotel Lawrence made the experience unforgettable at a price i could afford.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Lenny!”
Reviews.Author: Kay M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little worn and shabby, but the receptionist Lenny was fantastic, answered all our questions, even rang round to get a table on Thanksgiving. Hotel shuttle very useful. Location of hotel is good for the historic district, but not ideal for shopping and eateries. Dart station close, are really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price... just great!”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, this hotel rocks. I have read alot of reviews about this hotel, some great and some not so great. I have probably in my lifetime of 35 years, spent over 1000 actual days in booked rooms. Not every experience was pleasant, some just horrendous,to downright terrifying, and some were better than home, and left you with a real yearning for a return stay. I was only up for 1 night, booked on the fly after 2300 CST, through my favorite trusted online reservation service, got a killer rate, less than $60.00 before local tax rates, and was up less than 5 minutes after arrival. The lobby was spotless, every common area was clean, and the room was turned well and cozy. I was actually impressed with this hotel, didn't think I would be because of the rate, but I probably got a late price trigger (if that exists). There was a pot smoker on my floor, a non smoking floor, but hey, cigarette smokers are out and local code for non-smoking buildings doesn't include smoking pot in a public building, there are other statutes for that. . This hotel again is old, almost a century old, has been renovated, but has very distinct art deco decor. Yes, the rooms are smaller than some newer hotels, but the studio I was in had more than enough room, was really clean, and was just right. The bathroom was a little euro, but the shower was spot on (partial Swiss Shower with really hot water, and great water pressure, easy 1 hour steam if you need it.) I am really impressed this hotel gets alot of reviews, good and bad, but that is expected, it's a hotel, run by humans, not robots. This is the first hotel in over 1 year that I have booked that I can really say, "man, let me tell you about the room I had last night". The last was the Andaz NY 500 Wall @ Water St., another fabulous affordable find. If you need a room to sleep 5, find a hotel with link doors. If you want a hotel with charm, good service, !Clean Rooms!, an ideal location with fresh c. breakfast and coffee and rockin' waffles, this place is the best value I have found, in downtown Dallas, period. For a hunski or two more, try the Adolphus 7 blocks east of the Lawrence, it is way more elegant, has suites if you need it, and will leave you feeling like a rich ahole for a few minutes, until you enter your own reality again, well unless you are really a rich ahole, or just rich and not an ahole, but could become an ahole after wasting so much money on overnight upgrades, JK. By the way if you like a little bit of adventure at hotels, this one does not have water slides or all you can eat Eddie Griswold buffets, but the 10th floor claims folklore, and ghostly presences, even visits by some cable tv ghost hunter shows.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: ldwheeler2002
Reviews.Content: So glad I decided to stay here. Great location very helpful staff. Traveled to Dallas for a concert and shopping we were shuttled to the concert and took a cab back. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rockreation
Reviews.Content: Excellent value, well appointed, comfortable. Good service, terrific breakfast. Well located on outskirt of Colonial district, 200 metres from the Grassy Knoll where John F Kennedy was assasinated in 1963.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisabug1021
Reviews.Content: It was clean, comfortable, and friendly. The hotel was what you would expect from a 3 star hotel...just a bit dated but definitely had personality. The desk clerk was wonderful and gave us coupon cards to all the downtown restaurants. The shuttle driver took us to the restaurant and offered to pick us up but we walked back. Everything was within walking distance. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever”
Reviews.Author: Megan P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dirty, shabby, in a horrible part of town, offers no parking, and has a rude, unprofessional staff. There was no manager on duty for the entirety of our stay. The shuttle dropped up off at our destination then refused to pick us up as they advertise on their website. We were actually threatened by an abrasive, erratic, and largely incoherent hotel employee; yet our complaint was entirely disregarded by the onsite staff. I have put in 4 calls to the manager since we left and no one seems to know when he will get in. I feel that they are purposely avoiding my calls. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Handy hotel for main Dallas sights”
Reviews.Author: birminghamcorbiere
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Dallas as our first stop after long flight from the UK. Good points: easy to get to by car from airport. Very pleasant and helpful receptionist ( an older guy called Lenny) who arranged valet parking for us as we were really tired, at no higher cost than it would have been to park up ourselves.Environment was kind of " shabby-chic", quite an old fashioned reception area,but clean.It was cheap for Dallas, but perhaps only so as we had booked well in advance.The hotel is an easy and safe walk to the West End district, with variety of restaurants, bars and shops. Breakfast was a hlp yourself buffet with a selection of cereals, fruit, boiled eggs, toast and waffles, entirely adequate. The hotel offers a free bus drop off/pick up service to anywhere within a 3 mile radius. Just down the street is the Texas Book Depository and the infamous Grassy Knoll, with excellent nuseum charting the JFKennedy rise and ultimate assassination.Plus the tourist info place is right there too.We also made use of the hotel secure boxes, which was good to have at the start of our vacation. Negatives: Though our room was adequate in terms of size and facilities, and the bed was reasonably comfortable, the room did smell badly of stale cigarette smoke. On arrival, Lenny noted that the room initially allocated to us had been allocated to someone else, so perhaps this was the only alternative available? Anyway, I guess we could have complained and asked for a room change, but to be honest, we knew we would not be in the room much, and we were too tired to bother asking the first night. Probably a mistake. Overall, it was an OK stopover, perfectly adequate, but, in spite of Lenny's welcome and helpfulness, we would probably choose somewhere else to stay if we return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “WORST hotel experience, ever.”
Reviews.Author: Dootdoot
Reviews.Content: The only employee I encountered was harshly judgemental and unwelcoming. She accused us of smoking and tried to talk to us like children. We didn't even stay an hour and left. They even charged us a $25 "incident fee."

Reviews.Title: “Nice people, Nice place”
Reviews.Author: sj g
Reviews.Content: I had a speaking engagement in Dallas on Monday, September 12. Took a road trip from San Antonio, and was pleased with my room and the environment at the Hotel Lawrence. The staff was very hospitable and I enjoy the quaint character of the room's furnishings. The parking situation was horrible, but an understandable inconvenience in lieu of the great rate. I would love to return and stay while travellng by train, as the Amtrak station is right across the street. It's definitely not a place for everyone, but its just right for me!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bingo2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Lawrence in May and was really pleased with it. THe location is great, right across the road from the Train Station, 2 minutes walk from the JFK Musuem and book depository, and within walkin distance of loads of cool bars and restaurants. It was really cheap as well. The rooms are not the most modern, but they are clean and bed was comfortable. Internet access in the lobby and Founders grill next door which does room service. My only criticism was the lift was broken for most of our stay. all in all its a nice hotel in a great location, would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not very "Boutique"”
Reviews.Author: slatsyrc
Reviews.Content: This hotel advertises itself as a "boutique" hotel, but the rooms are very small and not very nice. They only had one elevator that worked and was a pain to wait on. Our glass sink was cracked. My husband and I shared the room with another couple and it was VERY crowded. Parking here is also weird. You can pay a guy daily to park in the paid lot behind the hotel or pay for valet. The maid retrieved my car when we checked, but she made sure to keep her dirty glove on to keep her hands from getting dirty. After she brought me my car, I pointed that out to her and she quickly removed the glove after she had already drove my car with it on. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: 7thgentexanAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: My daughter reserved a room for herself and father from out of town, as it was a block from the court house, and they had a very important court hearing on July 5th. With the stress, my daughter left a very special one carat diamond ring that cannot be replaced from sentiment, along with 2 less valuable rings. After 2 calls, and finally my husband calling, we were told the cleaning person's name, and that they would talk to her. My husband offered a reward, knowing that would only admit guilt from someone, but that they would talk to her supervisor. A message on my daughter's cell phone, was left 2 days later that they did not find them in the room. I want this exposed, as a hotel is only worthy if one can trust them. Very disappointed that the rings were not returned.. and a sad daughter.

Reviews.Title: “It was not so bad.”
Reviews.Author: candigirl
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights in June . Got a good price on PL. I felt some of the reviews I read here were somewhat unfair, as I found the hotel to be quite adequate, but maybe I did not go expecting much. Ok, true, SOME of the rooms are small, but not all of the rooms. As we walked down the narrow halls, we peeked into some of the ones that housekeeping was cleaning, and I noticed a few different sizes. We had a corner room, with windows facing the Plaza/Courthouse, and I would say it was slightly larger than others. We had 2 double beds. Did not experience any bedbugs, and the room was clean. True also the Hotel is OLD. It is a Historic hotel, There is no pool, and I didn't see a gym. The internet connection sucks. The bathrooms are tiny and have been decorated in what I think was supposed to be art deco style. You can barely turn around in them, and there is nowhere to put your toiletries, not cool for 2 females sharing a bathroom. There are no microwaves or fridges in the room. So don't bother saving your leftover 40 dollar dinner to eat later, lol. The lobby served cookies and milk, we did not eat in the adjoining resturant. We did eat the free breakfast, and it was fine, clean and sunny eating area on the 2nd floor. Yes elevators are small, so if you have lots of luggage, it may require 2 trips. There is only 1 computer in the lobby and the printer was out but the front desk printed our boarding passes for us. The location is great, across the street from union station, and the metro rail, which can take you all over dallas for 4 bucks, and you can walk to Market square, where there are all types of eateries. We also walked to House of blues and dicks last resort. Dealey plaza is right across the street from the hotel. The front desk people were nice, especially the young man who checked us in, can't remember his name but he was great, the woman on the night shift was a little chilly, but was not unprofessional. The best staff are the shuttle drivers! They took us to our Palladium ballroom destination, and to deep ellum, and because it was a relatively slow afternoon, at checkout they took us to Dallas Love field! How is that for going ABOVE the call of duty? Tip the shuttle drivers well folks! They raise the level of this hotel by at least 1 star! We heard the hotel is haunted, but didn't see any ghosts or hear anything strange. Oh, we happened to be there the morning of the Mavricks parade, and had a spot on view from our 9th floor window. Several people checking in were complaining about parking, but i'm sure it was because of the parade, the hotel fille up completely the night before. Overall our stay was fine, not a lot of bells and whistles, but not a dump either.

Reviews.Title: “The people wrere very nice!”
Reviews.Author: look4meWestTexas
Reviews.Content: The staff was great and the hotel was very clean. Yes, the rooms are small and it is a very old hotel but the staff make up for these flaws.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: DFrey86
Reviews.Content: I picked Hotel Lawrence, through Hotels.com and got a ridiculously cheap rate. I read some reviews and remained optimistic. It is a very outdated hotel. I'm sure it was great in its prime. I will say the room was so clean, which I greatly appreciated. If you aren't picky and you just want a clean mediocre place you'll be happy. If you want luxurious and fancy you won't be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “disÂ·gustÂ·ing”
Reviews.Author: Aussie_Traveller_m8
Reviews.Content: Got to hotel late at night, valet parking doesn't exist, had to park in dodgy parking lot, surprised my car was still their in the morning. Room was disgusting, toe nails and hair on bathroom floor. Thank god I was only their for 6 hrs. Any more and I think I would of gone crazzzzy

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: flyysince89
Reviews.Content: The hotel was old, the elevators worn and wobbly . The room was so tiny , with a very small tv and a window that did not open . The bed was decently comfortable , the bathroom was about the nicest portion of this hotel . Can`t say I`ll be returning on my next trip to Dallas , it wasn`t for me ! But a good location . The parking is a joke , you have to park in a back lot that you have to pay for which was not favorable at all . They don`t validate parking , so the parking situation was a mess to say the least .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location; more than adequate; helpful & pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: TexanJerseyite
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Lawrence on three occasions, choosing it the first time because it was right across the street from the train station from where I was arriving and departing, and choosing it subsequently for the same reason plus my my general satisfaction with it. Even though some time has passed since I was last there, I had to respond, as I was appalled by the negative reviews that came up first, none more recent than two years ago! I experienced none of the horrible things related in those bed reviews. I found the complimentary breakfast to be very good. The breakfast suit has wonderful views from large windows of the historical district, so much of which is walking distance from the Lawrence. Also, the van took me to the art museum and sculpture garden and to founders park where the wonderful bronze longhorn cattle herd "runs." Other reviewers have mentioned how handy the van was for them; it's indeed a valuable amenity. The cookies and milk in the lobby at night are wonderful! My room was clean and comfortable; and the views from the windows were classic: iconic Dallas! I never had trouble sleeping, nor did I experience any irritating noise. I am very sensitive to odors and have no memory of being put off by anything such as some other reviewers described. My bathrooms on all occasions were clean and appeared either modern or retro, depending on what type of room I was in, but always in perfect working order. Housekeeping gave me extra bottled water. In intend to stay at the Lawrence next time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: TVChick16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on December 31, 2009. We wanted a hotel that was within walking distance from the attractions we were interested in as well as the New Years Eve festivities at the American Airlines Center area. This hotel fit the bill. We paid $92 + tax for one night which I didn't think was too bad since it was a holiday and since there were a lot of people in town for the bowl game as well. Upon arrival, there was no place to pull up to the hotel and unload, so my husband pulled around the corner and put a couple quarters in the meter. We checked into our room and unloaded. We ended up parking in the Union Station lot since it was only $5. We were given a room with a great view of the Old Red Museum and Dealey Plaza. The room was small, but adequate. There was no refrigerator, so we filled the sink and our small cooler with ice. The Hotel Lawrence offered fresh baked cookies in the evening and we went down to the lobby to get a few. They were good, but tasted like they were cut from a roll of pre-made dough. Still a nice gesture. We slept well in the room. Since it was New Years Eve, you could hear some partying late into the evening, but we had been partying as well and had no problem falling asleep. We safely walked to the AA Center for the New Years Eve concerts, festivities and fireworks that evening. On New Years Day we walked to the Sixth Floor Museum in the morning and also to the New Years Day parade downtown. We walked to the Spaghetti Factory for lunch. The hotel was a great home base because we never had to move our car out of the Union Station lot. The breakfast room in the hotel was small and crowded since the hotel had probably been at capacity for the holiday. We were able to snag a table. The included breakfast buffet offered a lot of options. The best thing was the Texas-shaped waffles! If we ever need to stay in downtown Dallas again, we would stay here if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff, Beware of Parking”
Reviews.Author: annikalibby
Reviews.Content: I arrived at midnight and was told valet parking was full. Then instructed to walk around and find a meter, at midnight, in downtown Dallas as a single female. I walked to a meter only to find in bright letters "2 hour limit, Meters Effective 7 Days a Week" not to mention that parking at a meter was $.25 per ten minutes. Even if I had that many quarters on me, my car would be towed unless I moved it every two hours all night long. There is a single, small surface lot adjacent to the hotel with a pay box but it too was full with only two empty spaces marked "reserverd". After much more discussion, the staff managed to find a spot for my car considering my special circumstances, but buyer beware that if you arrive late you may end up parking far, far away and walking by yourself in the middle of the night. I was told that the nearest parking lot with available spots at that hour was Union Station. The staff (nor the owners) cannot control the parking situation in downtown, but I feel it is only ethical to warn potential clients of the situation I found myself in. I was ready to walk away and lose my money rather than venture out alone a third time in search of parking. Not to mention that if I had accepted the hotel at its word and simply parked at a meter I would have had the chance of being towed for staying there 10 plus hours. Apparently at one point the meters were not effective on weekends so this was what they suggested to guests regularly. If you have no car to worry about (arrive via taxi, etc) then I can wholeheartedly reccomend this hotel. The room was very comfortable and clean, the staff was kind and polite throughout, and the hotel itself was appealing and quiet. All basic amenities, including fitness room and continental breakfast and delightful toiletries were provided. I will only stay again if I fly into Dallas sadly.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel to consider!”
Reviews.Author: mickottley
Reviews.Content: If you have an interest in Dealey Plaza and events that happened there, the only place to stay is Hotel Lawrence. It overlooks the plaza and can be clearly seen in films of those shocking events in 1963. Our room had a view of the plaza and Old Red Courthouse but views all around are beautiful! The place is steeped in history and the hotel retains all of its original features. Our room was clean, tidy, air conditioned, comfortable and always immaculate. The bathroom was newly refurbished and clean. There was a useful writing desk and a coffee maker and coffee and water supplied. Breakfast is always complimentary and all you can eat including waffle making machines and eggs galore!! On the evening milk and cookies are put out free of charge on the excellent and comfortable foyer. The staff were excellent and friendly and took a genuine interest in us. One minute's walk to the main train station, who could ask for more. The best hotel I have ever stayed in made this the best holiday I have ever had. Thanks guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again, not even if its free”
Reviews.Author: BalletDallas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel the night prior and the night of our wedding. While we were away on our honeymoon out of the country, this hotel charged my card as well as my husbands (double charging us) not only for the rooms but also for damages that were in the hotel prior to our arrival (trying to charge my husband for over $1200 in preexisting damages). We were told the charges for the room would be a total of $650 and instead they tacked on an additional $140. All of our wedding guests that booked through our block did not receive the advertised amount, charging them anywhere from $50-100 more than what they said the rates were. The sales rep we have dealt with has continually been impossible to reach, rude and (I believe) is flat out lying to us about many of the things she brings up. The rooms all smelt of mold and urine, and most of the phones in the rooms don't work. We tried to contact the front desk about various issues to no avail. We never received more towels, another blanket, none of the rooms in our wedding block worked (none out of the 15 people staying there!!). The breakfast they provide was mediocre at best. A small selection of yogurt and toast, batter for waffles but no functioning waffle maker. The employees were all extremely rude and no help at all. They only have one functioning elevator and apparently have no plans to have this repaired in the foreseeable future.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel, don't believe the haters.”
Reviews.Author: mler13
Reviews.Content: I got this cheap rate at the last minute without reading all the negative reviews. Then i got super worried. But once we actually got to the hotel we realized it was a perfectly fine old place. I can only speak for my room/visit, but this is what I expect from any 1930s hotel not run by a huge chain. Friendly service, clean remodeled room with some original features. Located across from the historic county courthouse and near where President Kennedy was shot back in the 60s and Deep Ellum. They have free fresh baked chocolate chip cookies and milk in the lobby at night. Pet friendly with valet and real restaurant. I missed the continental breakfast so can't comment on that. My room looked just like the site photos. No free parking. The downtown self park is just as much as the valet My room was neat and clean. They go for the white clean bedspreads rather than weird floral ones. Had the standard little desk and TV. Free bottled water in your room, real glassware. Yes, it a little on the small side but certainly not unreasonable. Support your local businesses people, not everything has to be huge and brand spanking new. What about charm and personal service that this place offers in abundance?

Reviews.Title: “NASTY NASTY NASTY”
Reviews.Author: rocktours
Reviews.Content: Changed rooms 3 times. Smelled like old antiques and cat urine. This place should be leveled and replaced with a parking deck . This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in and the city of Dallas should shut it down. Dont go to the restaurant because no one will wait on you. This place made me absolutely sick. Spend an extra $20.00 and stay at the Marriott around the corner...... It would be safer and cleaner! I would rather stay in a hostel with homeless people...... Thats how bad this place is. WHAT A S@#% HOLE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Total dump”
Reviews.Author: doc33
Reviews.Content: This is a dump. Do not stay here. Drive to Adolphus and get a better room. It's old, outdated, smells bad, dirty, and has tiny little beds they call a queen but is clearly a double circa 1920. This hotel needs to be demolished theres no hope for renovation. The pictures are totally misleading. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a scam...beware”
Reviews.Author: blueoktober
Reviews.Content: I did not stay in this hotel, but I feel obligated to warn people about this hotel's tactics. I made a reservation about a month ago for 2 bed 1 room for 2 nights. I got a rate of $105 per night. After a friend in Dallas told me the hotel wasn't very nice, I started reading reviews. One of the complaints that seemed to happen a lot is that when a guest checked into the hotel, they weren't provided the proper room as specified in the original reservation. So I called the front desk to make sure I had a 2 bed, 1 room reservation, I was told that I HAD NOT - I had a one bed reservation. When I explained this wasn't what I was told when I booked, I was put on hold for about 15 minutes then finally "Maggie" came back and told me she was able to change the room to a 2 bed and she would send me an email confirmation immediately. Well, this didn't happen. So later that night I called to make sure it had been changed and asked for an email. The guy at the front desk sends me my email, and what do you know? The rate changed from $105 to $159 a night! So I called back and asked to cancel - the guy gave me grief and said "wait till tomorrow to talk to the manager so maybe you can get the rate changed" I politely told him no, that I wanted to cancel now - this all seemed too fishy to me. So he says he will cancel it and send an email. Never did. I called the reservation line that bypasses the front desk and was told that there was no cancellation on the reservation, but she would cancel it for me and send me an email. 30 minutes go by and I still have no confirmation email. So I call back - there was NO CANCELLATION REQUEST put in on this reservation. So I got the girl's name, asked for a cancellation number and was PROMISED an email. Well guess what? No email for cancellation. I am over it. I put a stop payment on credit card for this reservation. This place has the WORST customer service and just seem so sneaky and dishonest - be very wary of making a reservation at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The pictures are deceiving and there were additional charges on my account upon returning home.”
Reviews.Author: millerpatr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 02/26/1/2011 for a 2 day event at the convention center. There is a deposit of $75.00 for any repairs that they don't tell you about when you book the room, just when you get there to check in. If you refuse, you don't get the room but they will charge you for the room. The lobby of the hotel smelled strongly of urine. The room was small and filthy. There was no comforter on the bed. The carpet was badly stained. The TV was at least 10 years old and didn't get any channels. The bathtub had hair in it , dirty shoe prints and the drain was rusted. There was a stain (red) running down the wall under the entrance way. When I asked in the lobby, they sent me to another room that was just as filthy so I went back to the original room. Went out and bought cleaning supplies and cleaned the bathroom myself. Upon returning home, I found two charges were made on my card. One for the room fee (with the deposit included) and another for $125.00. When I called the hotel and spoke with Mark, he said he cannot see that they charged me for anything but the room fee. I just filed fraudulent charges with my bank. DON'T STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not rely on internet pictures, descriptions . . . misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: BuffyOKC
Reviews.Content: I've read several reviews that attempt to equate the small rooms and "quaintness" of this hotel to a European boutique hotel . . . well I've stayed at such hotels and this is not one. We reserved two rooms for two nights several months ago and when we checked in we were unable to get rooms next each other. When we got to the rooms, we were disappointed in the size, dÃ©cor and the â€œamenitiesâ€� for the cost of $189 a night . . . we immediately went downstairs and asked to leave but we were told we would be charged for the night; so faced with a $400 bill we went ahead and stayed and checked out the next day. This hotel is way over-priced at $189 a night; however, most of the staff we dealt with were polite and the desk clerk on duty when we checked out honored our original reservation price of $149. I am really astounded that this hotel has so many positive reviews based on our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Never again...”
Reviews.Author: crazygirl1980
Reviews.Content: After being on a bus for 22 hours and finally arriving at the Hotel Lawerence at 4 am, I bawled my eyes out when we got to the room. I realize it's suppose to be a boutique hotel but, there was nothing charming about it. I have stayed in some pretty shady places but, this one took the cake. I have stayed in an old chicken coop, do to rain, while camping one night and it was cleaner than this place. We walked in to what looked like pigeon poop on the floor. The white coverlet on the bed and floor were covered in black soot from the furnace. When we took the waffle coverlet off the bed there were stains on the waffle blanket. I was so tired that I just wanted to brush my teeth, wash my face and lay my head down...Thank God for my own pillow. When I turned on the water in the bathroom, it was either hot or demonic. The bathtub should have been condemned. After crying, my husband and I just started laughing hysterically and started hanging up our clothes in something that resembled a closet. When opening the "closet" door, you could see through a hole in the wall to the hallway. Our company was there for the Super Bowl and we had 7 rooms. Each in their own special ways had issues. After complaining to management they assured us that they had just been screwed by their contractors. She didn't see anything wrong with our rooms, after taking a "tour" through all 7 rooms. I'm not a complainer and I am definitely not a liar. Well...after reviewing some other reviews on the hotel, it dates back to 2008 with the same exact problems. During our stay, the one elevator that worked, broke down and the fire alarm went off for no apparent reason. I gave a 2 for service because, Ruthie, was great. She knew exactly how we felt and tried to make our stay as nice as possible. Convenience to downtown was great. Cindi's cafe, walking distance from the hotel, is phenomenal. There is a bar/restaurant connected to the hotel. I did not eat there but the first night we went, they "closed" the bar at 9:40, when they have a closing time at 10. I was in the bar industry for a long time and if someone wants a drink, you give them a drink. The last night we were there the bartender happened to be part owner...he was great and apologized for his lazy bartender. I hope that they can pull it together someday because of the location and history. However, I will not be staying there EVER again.

Reviews.Title: “conference 2010”
Reviews.Author: johnpg2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times,The hotel is friendly,quite in general and central and for the conference good value $79 i would not pay more than this. I have been coming here since 1999 and since its upgrade not much has changed,The rooms are small and T.V.s need upgrading,my air con was broke and nights were cold as they had gone back to sheets and taken away the duvets. The milk and cookies are great but you have to be quick as people you have not seen all day swarm like locusts when they arrive,Breakfast is free and enough to eat some cold meats would be a help and cheese. THE BAR is the same as it has ever been overpriced and not run by the hotel not open on a sunday or after 22-00pm and dont stay Thanksgiving nothings open mind you to be fair a lot of the hotels are like this now in Dallas,I would say this to the Lawrence,Tidy the place up Get the Bar and Resturant under your control and make sure everything works in the rooms

Reviews.Title: “The worst convention/business hotel ever...”
Reviews.Author: VLVAN
Reviews.Content: Old, dirty hotel. In need of major renovation. chipped paint on walls, chipped ceramic in bath tub, dirty molding. only one elevator was working.

Reviews.Title: “Neighborhood is sketchy and hotel is terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Chy4wvu
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews but chose to side with the ones liked it (btw, that has to be the staff giving those reviews!!). I thought it was a decent deal but when I realized I paid almost 150 a night for what is essentially an overrated roach motel, it was too late! To their credit the staff is very friendly but completely unorganized. They got my mixed up with another one in valet, then proceeded to not put the valet ticket in the window so the parking garage issued a ticket to my vehicle! Yet, they still charged me for valet (as a seperate charge done after I checked out because they originally forgot to charge me and had to run my card twice!) The rooms are super small, they sell it as a "deluxe queen" but they only have one type of room and it is has full size bed and an old school RCA t.v. I don't even want to talk about how small the bathroom is. I can appreciate older hotels and actually even prefer them, but this is not just the "character" of a building, the carpet needs to be replaced and it's dirty EVERYWHERE! In short, listen to what others are saying about this hotel and save yourself the trouble!!

Reviews.Title: “Misrepresented”
Reviews.Author: OleTex05
Reviews.Content: I must say that the staff was very friendly, albeit slow. This is one of the most misrepresented hotels I have stayed in. The pictures shown online are in vast contrast to the actual hotel experience. The rooms are very small. The elevators (only one worked while our stay) are excruciatingly slow and the walls are paper thin, allowing noise from the adjacent rooms to infiltrate our guest room. The hot water during our stay was spotty at best - either scalding hot or freezing cold with no constant pressure. The description of the bathroom online stated dual shower heads, while our bathroom had only one that was antiquated. The continental breakfast was okay, and of the caliber I would expect from a LaQuinta - not a $200+/night, boutique hotel. The overall atmosphere presented was dark, dingy, and dirty - not the cool, 1920's-esque experience my girlfriend and I had expected when reading the website. Overall, our experience was poor. The hotel uses descriptive phrases such as 'destined to be one of Dallas' premier downtown hotels'. This could be true, after an extensive revitalization and renovation. Dollar for dollar, I would recommend the Hyatt next door.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting location for a classy jewel”
Reviews.Author: CindyMobile_AL
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to the powers that be! We really enjoyed our stay this past weekend. Yes, the rooms are quaint in their own way but what I was most impressed with was the service. The entire staff, front desk, shuttle crew and maid service, was very professional and friendly. I guess it shows when you have a happy crew working together. Keep up the great work. If business calls for me to be in that area I'll be back for sure as well as recommend to others. Thanks, Cindy Ballis 1-251-653-9258

Reviews.Title: “ronnie coleman”
Reviews.Author: bigtrevor
Reviews.Content: my partner and i stayed at the lawerence hotel in february,while on a trip to train with 8 times mr olympia.we had a great time there the staff were very friendly and rooms good.the hotel is close to all the attractions and train station and dart system.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in the Hotel Lawrence in Dallas, Texas!”
Reviews.Author: dallaslodging
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Lawrence for three nights with our teenage son while we visited Dallas for the first time. We booked this hotel via Priceline (name your own price). We were disappointed immediately upon seeing the hotel,because it did not look as good asit did in the online photos. Once we entered we were even more disappointed. The inside of the hotel was not clean. We waited in line a long time to check in, behind only one other person. We had to pay $20 more per night to have a room with two beds, and paid $15 per day for valet parking. We didn't mind that our room was small, but it was not as clean as it could havebeen. The free breakfast was horrible. Although we paid for valet parking, I looked out our window one morning at 6:15 a.m. and saw our car parked on the street in front of the hotel. I looked out again at 7:00 a.m. and it was gone! We returned to our room one afternoon at 2:45 p.m. and the room had not been cleaned! And when they cleaned it they did not give us clean water glasses or remove obvious trash, like a soda can. Yes, we left them on the table,because there was no room in the one tiny trashcan in the bathroom! Waited two hours for a blanket and received it only after calling back to the desk. Theonly highlight of this hotel was the nice ride in the hotel van to the 6th Floor Museum, and the semi-prompt pickup for our return to thoe hotel. Overall, it was a very unpleasant lodging experience, and we would not stay there again even if the room was free!

Reviews.Title: “This is conveniently located and the personal service is great”
Reviews.Author: LPearce53
Reviews.Content: I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again. This is a very friendly staff and will make your trip very enjoyable and affordable. The continental breakfast was perfect each morning and a great way to start the day. From the front desk staff to the exceptional shuttle drivers, Z, Mike and Shane. This location is great , a short walk to the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: mbrown0500
Reviews.Content: My little sister was married in the Old Red Museum across the street from the hotel Lawrence. So for convenience reasons we all stayed here. When we returned back from the wedding at 1 am we found the elevator broken. My sister had to walk up 10 flights of stairs in her wedding dress!!! Without so much as an apology from the hotel staff. After arguing with them my parents were allowed to put the gifts in a small closet downstairs, rather than carry them up to their room on the 7th floor! Even before the elevator broke it was going VERY slow. I personally waited more than 5 minutes with my children and all of our bags for the elevator to arrive. Then we complained to the manager the next day she was hateful. She did refund half of our room, but only have much complaint. She slammed the money on the desk and continue to type heavily on her keyboard. I would NEVER stay here again. The pictures online are very deceiving. I visited 3 rooms and not 1 was as nice as the pictures posted.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: TammyeMarkham
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel. Friendly Staff. Room was very clean and comfortable. Hotel conveniently located near many attractions. Will stay at this Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly staff make for a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Merewright
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice little hotel. It is more along the lines of the European hotels(fairly small) but the staff make up for the size. Even in a 5 star hotel the staff don't measure up to the staff at Hotel Lawrence. It is conveniently located near the West End & not far from Reunion tower. They have a shuttle van that will take you anywhere in downtown Dallas. The restaurant that is in the hotel is ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!!!!! They have the best chicken fried steak I have eaten in years. Their mashed potatoes are really home made & not just mashed baked. They actually put butter & milk in them. The lasagna & the fish(in cream sauce) were excellent. They actually make their own Cesare dressing & it is great. I cannot rave enough about this little place called the Founder's Grill & the value for the dollar is super!!!! Can't wait to get back to Dallas & eat there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Value in the shadow of the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: Douggorman
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights in this European Style hotel. Rooms were small but comfortable (average beds). Bathroom was clean and very nice. Free Water. Free Internet. Free Breakfast (with make your own waffles.) Free local Shuttle around. Very friendly and helpful hotel staff. All for less than a hundred bucks a night -- Great Value!

Reviews.Title: “Cookies and milk a different touch, still appreciated”
Reviews.Author: Pusskka
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time at Hotel Lawrence. The male manager was very friendly, he enjoyed baking cookies for the customers every night for supper, served with milk of course. This was a complimentary offer as well as breakfast. Breakfast was some cereal, pastries, make your own waffles and toast. Nothing too exciting but I'm a toast girl so I was happy! The pastries weren't too tasty, croissants were terrible and the muffins tasted like cardboard. The room was small, the bathroom small, but we managed! We didn't have a view from the south side of the hotel, but all the north side rooms had a view of Old Red and of the Sixth Floor Museum. Housekeeping is the biggest worry. One day we left our room at 7.30am and didn't return until 8pm and our room still hadn't been serviced. Not that we are that picky, but as we were getting dressed for dinner we were asked to leave the room by the housekeeper who was dressed up to go clubbing so she could finish it. When we asked for half an hour as we needed privacy to get dressed for dinner she wasn't too happy - perhaps we made her late to her party? Location is great, only a few blocks to the tram/train which can take you to different locations in Dallas such as Deep Ellum and the north side, or make a day of it and train it to Fort Worth to watch the muster!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't like this hotel, don't go to Europe (or New York City)”
Reviews.Author: telliott10
Reviews.Content: My recent (and lengthly) stay was very pleasant. Perhaps it was because I was over the cooling towers, but I had no problem with noise. In any case, the room had a dream machine for ambiant noise if need be. The staff was very courteous and responsive to every request. The room was clean, and although small, I have stayed in smaller in Europe and New York. To those complaining about size, well, dont go to Europe, Japan or other places. Any issue that was negative I have read on other reviews are all matters I have encountered at Comfort, and even Hampton. So those checking out this Hotel because you cant get in the Hyatt for your conference, it is within walking distance, and they provide a shuttle if you need it. Breakfast is standard fare but served on real plates with real flatware (the Hampton could take a clue from this), If you are a solo traveler, this is a good bet, if not, you may want a suite. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Bon Voyage.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Lawrence staff were gracious and the accommodations were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: TammyLeitzel
Reviews.Content: My 14 yr old nephew and I stayed at Hotel Lawrence on a Saturday night. We had a wonderful time. The staff were friendly, pleasant, and helpful. The valet service was prompt both upon arrival and departure. We asked for 1 blanket and it was delivered by the time we got to the room. Breakfast was tasty. We got to make our big-Texas shaped waffles with fruit. Starbucks coffee!!!! My newphew had a variety of muffins, pastries, cereal, juices, water, eggs from also to choose. We had permission from the front desk to explore the hotel to experience a hotel built in 1925. I have back problems and have to sleep on a couch at home but Hotel Lawrence queen sized mattress was sooo comfortable. I have got to get the brand of the mattress. I slept through the entire night. First time I can remember doing so. I have read reviews complaining about the slow elevators. Yes, they are slow but the hotel was built in 1925, COME ON, cut them some slack-what do you expect. The hotel is conveniently located to museums and restaurants within walking distance. I felt very safe walking with my nephew downtown in the WESTEND to explore the candy shops, souvenir shops, and any type of restaurant one would want. We did not realize there was a restaraunt in the hotel. Next time we plan on trying it. Thank you Hotel Lawrence for making this a spring break experience my nephew and I will cherish! Oh yes, free internet so bring your laptop! Tammy Leitzel

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: mr1204
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Lawrence this past weekend and had a great time! The staff went out of their way to make things easy for us, letting us store our bags until check in time, and storing them again the next day after checkout. They were friendly and treated us like family. We took the train to Dallas, so parking wasnt an issue. That was our second time to stay there and we would definitely stay there again. I agree that it isnt for everyone, but for us, it was perfect! Excellent location!

Reviews.Title: “+Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keviner11
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable and quality service. Rooms are small.but great views of the old county courthouse and convenient to west end and downtoen attractions. It reminded me of old eropoen style type hotel. Had courtesy computer and a nice breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “I would definatley come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: tattedspider
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect because I had to conduct business at the dallas meps.The staff was inviting and accomodating, parking was great. Loved the continental breakfast. Beutiful view of the city. Stylish bathrooms. Bath and body works toiletries. Their version of happy hour is great for kids and adults alike because of the milk and cookies. Realy what more can I say for the price,location, and hospitality.My family and I usualy stay at the Marriot. But we will start coming to the HOTEL LAWRENCE from now on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AmyL12
Reviews.Content: Close to everything Kennedy as well as several good restaurants and other attractions. The only time we took a cab was to and from the airport - - we were able to walk everywhere else we wanted to go. Positives were historic look, clean rooms, friendly staff, cookies and milk served each night and complimentary breakfast. Areas that could be improved were the fitness room (the tread mills do not turn on easily) and the elevator (only one small one for all guests to share).

Reviews.Title: “rude staff, no parking, bar not open and did I mention rude staff”
Reviews.Content: We booked a blocked of rooms for out of town guests and ourselves following my husbands 40th birthday. We returned to the hotel and were immediately treated like we were "spring breakers". It was a weekend evening. Typically, guests are up a little later on the weekends. We had two guest that were smokers, so due to the hotel being a non smoking hotel, they went outside. About 4 or 5 of us that were still up decided to follow them in order to keep the hallways quiet. We decided to visit outside. Within 19 minutes, the police showed up. We were curious to see what was going on. Much to our surprise, the police pulled the two individuals that were smoking aside and made them sit on the curb. One of the individuals is a soldier and the other is outstanding woman that has never been in trouble a day of her life. When we asked what was going on, the female police officer put her finger in my chest and told us to back off. They said the hotel had called them. We found this very strange considering we were outside to avoid noise in the hotel and following the rules of "nonsmoking" by spending time outside. We were treated like we were children instead of adults in their 40's. When we tried to speak with the front desk, she said that she would phone the police. She was very unprofessional and a bit young. The gentleman that had been placed on the curb previously by the police returned outside once again a couple of hours later to smoke a cigarette and when the doors locked behind him, the front desk did not want to open the doors for him, stating that he was part of the group from earlier. We will never stay here again and since we all work in the travel industry, we have done our best to spread the word on the hotel. We spend most of our spare time traveling when we are not working and this was unbelievable treatment of guest. My very dear friend that travels in from Harfield actually recommended this hotel to us and he has since changed his hotel arrangements due to this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of the hotel; the comfort of the beds and the overall atmosphere. The breakfast was really good--not just your average continental breakfast. The rooms were small but comfortable--it was an older hotel that had been redone very nicely. The location couldn't have been any better; right across the street from Union Station and the Old Red Courthouse on the other corner; close to West End and all the great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: skincaregal1954
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Lawrence while in Dallas for a convention. The site was chosen for us. We were really disappointed the first night there...no place to pull up and unload the bags, no convenient parking, the room was small and the banquet room where a group of us had a special dinner and award celebration was extremely hot. That said, the location grew on us. We thought our room and bed was comfortable. I liked the "old world" feel and ambience of the place. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the food was very good. The freshly baked cookies in the lobby every night were wonderful. It may have been a tad over priced but not too bad. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Tons of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: rjsykestx
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Lawrence. The room was very cute and clean. The breakfast was EXCELLENT. I was in town for a conference and the rates at the Hotel Lawrence were extremely competative. The shuttle driver, Mike, was most hospitable and helpful. I would certainly stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “It is haunted, it was on ghost lab!”
Reviews.Author: taylor030
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very gross, very small, and has a musty smell to it. There is not free parking. You either pay for someone else to park it or you find your own parking space by a parking meter. The place smells. You cannot sleep, because the light is let in by the cracks in the door, and the walls are thin, so you can hear people walking, snoring, talking, etc. There is nothing to do at the hotel, except count bugs crawling in your room. When i stayed there, there was only one elevator and it was very small and super slow. The beds are very uncomfortable. The bathroom, shower, bathtub..... disgusting. Helpful tip! Don't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “It's a dump.”
Reviews.Author: Nixjag
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel that was away from the convention I was attending at the Hyatt, and this place sounded ideal. Unfortunately it is soooo tired there was just nothing redeeming about it at all. The carpets were obviously decades old, the bathtub was 100 different shades of off white, the walls are so thin I only got one decent night's sleep out of three, and to top it off the Hyatt (where I could have stayed) was gorgeous. The food in the restaurant is typical hotel restaurant- forgettable and expensive. And forget about hanging out for a drink after dinner- you are shown the door at 10.30 (on a Thursday night)- no ifs. ands or buts- you're done when they want to go home!

Reviews.Title: “Simply charming and great location!”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsGoodTraveler
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its proximity to The House of Blues Dallas and The Craft Dallas. A previous reveiwer had mentioned that it was less expensive than surrounding hotels and that it was a good choice if you just needed a place to sleep. I am so glad I heeded his advice. I would stay at this hotel again. It has been written that parking is an issue. There are options. A parking lot is located right behind the hotel. It takes cash only. It is $10 on weekdays and $5 at night and weekends---you need exact amounts. The hotel provides a shuttle service on a first come, first served-basis. They will also call you a cab. Warning: Dallas cab drivers are snakes, keep an eye on the meter!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint.”
Reviews.Author: enlightenment
Reviews.Content: This hotel has tried very hard to modernize an old structure. I would call the design Art Deco but I have NO design background. We found the housekeeping staff helpful to our written request for the 2nd night. We asked for another pillow and another blanket as I found the bedding too light for the weather. We used the shuttle a lot and only waited minimally for a ride on a couple of occasions. There were certainly some small cosmetic maintenance issues; peeling paint type things. I found the mild and home made cookies every evening just charming and made the trip like home. My spouse already reviewed about the fire alarm annoyance. If it had been while we were sleeping, we would not ahve been happy.

Reviews.Title: “Tired low rent motel of the 80's”
Reviews.Author: JoeSchmoeLondon
Reviews.Content: Rooms - smelly, tired, grim. Bath blocked, lights broken & really shabby. Bar - closed as the barkeeper was tired so he threw us out Sunday at 6pm. Breakfast - small room, poor selection. Hotel amenities - Housekeeping may or may not bother to turn up. Only one lift which is about to expire of old age. The staff are a mix. Mark on the front desk is good, but the night lady was a rude unpleasant woman. Business- Old tired room with bad aircon and no idea of customer service. Avoid if you can at all help it. The pictures on the internet are misleading.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But I'm Conflicted”
Reviews.Author: msubobcats
Reviews.Content: This hotel has me a bit torn in my review. The hotel itself is wonderfully located, right by the Reunion Tower, Dealy Plaza and West End are within walking distance, Union Station right across the street to catch the DART trains (to the Fair!), and if that isn't enough, the hotel offers a shuttle to take you anywhere you want within a three mile radius (Farmers Market!). The hotel is older, but seemed to be well maintained with wonderful staff. Everyone was pleasant and the rooms were smallish but clean with a modern bathroom. However, one afternoon the fire alarm just kept sounding, on and off for several hours. We were told at the first sounding that "someone had opened an alarm door", then the next time "someone is smoking on the tenth floor", then the third time 'a bad wire and a technician is on the way". After those explainations, we stopped leaving the room and asking questions for the rest of the alarms. I thought the situation could have been handled better. Probably not smart on our behalf to stop leaving the room, in case there was an actual fire, but walking up and down 4 flights of stairs for no real solution gets to be bothersome. Had this happened from 1am to 4am, I could see myself getting upset because no-one knew the reason, thus no immediate soultion to the problem. Also, we did not receive the wake up call on Sunday morning, but I consider that my fault for not setting the clock alarm as a backup. Despite the alarms and extra sleep, I would definitely recommend this hotel, based on location alone. If you plan to sightsee Dallas, this is the place. Go Cats

Reviews.Title: “probably one of the best hotels ive ever stayed it”
Reviews.Author: sneezingmonkey
Reviews.Content: first off its not a modern super hotel. ive stayed in plenty of them and i find them somewhat generic and bland. what first made me think the hotel lawrence was different was the guy on the front desk. Didnt catch his name but when i booked in he was probably the nicest front desk guy i had ever met. And he helped me best he could with all the problems i came to him with The second thing that started to make me think the hotel was different was that they have milk and cookies in the foyer every evening. I mean...milk and cookies! So yeah its different. The hotel breakfast was top notch, the views from the room excellent too. The only fault i could find with the hotel was that i used the atm in the hotel and this for some reason gave me a crummy exchange rate. Not the fault of the hotel, if i were to stay again ild make sure i withdraw from a bank. If you dont have a laptop they offer a computer in the lobby with free internet. They ask you only use it for 20 minutes. I used it far longer than that sometimes (only when there wasnt anyone around waiting) and it was a great touch. To offer the service for free is a fantastic thing especially when some hotels make you pay Â£4 for 15 minutes. however remember theres only one computer, so if youre desperate to get onto the net you may have to wait your turn :) so yeah, smaller independent hotels that arent a mecure or hilton do need support. but only if they provide a service that is of decent quality. I think the hotel lawrence does this. So i feel compelled to support it.

Reviews.Title: “A nice mix of old character and modern comforts”
Reviews.Author: derijr
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here one night. We chose this hotel because of its proximity to Dealey Plaza. We loved our stay here. The hotel is very old, but that gives it a ton of character. Plus, the hotel has been updated with every possible modern convenience - such as fast wi-fi internet connection, great bathroom in the room, great beds and linens and a fantastic staff that was always at the ready to answer and questions.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lie on the internet”
Reviews.Author: harley036
Reviews.Content: The pictures are a joke, our room was the size of a cracker box. One elevator working only I wrote e mails to explain that we needed parking, what a joke. My handicapped husband had to walk 2 blocks out of a parking garage, while I handled all the luggage. The dining area next door was also a rip off. Never even think you can believe the pictures.
